duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct independent basic science experimentation and build a portfolio of research accomplishments.
Train graduate students and post-doctoral fellows in experimental design and technique.
Participate in editing and proofing grant proposals, annual grant reports, and manuscripts for publication.
Contribute to the preparation of articles on research outcomes and progress for publication.
Read and understand relevant scientific literature and present findings at lab meetings.
Communicate results and collaborate with other professionals in the lab.
Prepare figures and diagrams for presentations and publications.
Record experimental findings, analyze and interpret them, and suggest modifications to protocols based on results.
Develop participant-advocate relationships and assist in identifying community resources for study participants.
Attend staff meetings, case conferences, and individual and group supervision. Observe confidentiality rules and maintain professional standards at all times.
Participate in staff training and development and serve on designated committees within the study when appropriate.
Maintain understanding of clients’ rights policy and procedures.

education_certification.credential: Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Biomedical or Physical Sciences. Placement in position may not exceed three years.
